question: Does nifedipine inhibit L-type calcium channels?
ideal_answer: Yes, nifedipine is a typical blocker of L-type calcium channels.

snippets.text: Nifedipine, an L-type calcium channel blocker, reduced the expression of synaptogamin and syntaxin and blocked the suppressive effect of vecuronium, suggesting that both agents inhibit presynaptic L-type calcium channels.
